comments.body:
With 3.2.1 being the current Eclipse release, the previous builds are no longer
accessible via Eclipse's current download site but have been moved to the
archive location.

To get the build working, open build/build.properties.default and change the
following line
jdt.loc=http://sunsite.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1.2-200601181600/eclipse-JDT-3.1.2.zip
to
jdt.loc=http://archive.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1.2-200601181600/eclipse-JDT-3.1.2.zip
or use a mirror of archive.eclipse.org (if one exists).

One could also check whether the current 3.2.1 compiler works as a drop-in
replacement for the 3.1.2 version in Tomcat. But in this case I strongly doubt
that the devs will want to hear complaints if something doesn't work.

Ok, I got the notification of the archive change, fixed the link, and re-ran 
the ant build process and get the following (what is next??): 
 
 
================================================================= 
alweb15:~ # cd /srv/apps/tomcat-5.5.20/build/ 
balweb15:/srv/apps/tomcat-5.5.20/build # ls -la 
total 205 
drwxr-xr-x  4 root root   592 Oct 12 09:18 . 
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root   248 Oct 12 09:18 ..

-rw-r--r--  1 root root  6564 Oct 12 09:07 RELEASE-NOTES 
balweb15:/srv/apps/tomcat-5.5.20 # ant

1. After making the change to build/build.properties.default the build works
fine for me - as it propably will for everyone who is not making a build from
scratch even without that change. Therefore...
2. ...I see absolutely nothing that qualifies this bug as "major".
3. The problem you are now reporting is something different than the problem the
bug was opened for.
4. The build works for me and I see no reason to blame the Tomcat build system
for not working in your case. Since you gave absolutely no information about
your environment it's hard to tell what's wrong. Please post your question to
the users mailing list providing the relevant information. Bugzilla is not a
support forum.

(In reply to comment #3)
> 1. After making the change to build/build.properties.default the build works
> fine for me - as it propably will for everyone who is not making a build from
> scratch even without that change. Therefore...
> 2. ...I see absolutely nothing that qualifies this bug as "major".
> 3. The problem you are now reporting is something different than the problem 
the
> bug was opened for.
> 4. The build works for me and I see no reason to blame the Tomcat build system
> for not working in your case. Since you gave absolutely no information about
> your environment it's hard to tell what's wrong. Please post your question to
> the users mailing list providing the relevant information. Bugzilla is not a
> support forum.

Markus:

Many thanks for the prompt reply.

Is this a build bug, I do not know.  I do know that the build process does not 
complete.

I did make the change you requested to get the archived file.

Now it appears that the JSSE13SocketFactory.java package is attempting to 
include some files that do not exist.

Should these files be part of the download done by the ant build.

Where can I get the missing files to complete the build process?

Again many thanks in advance.

Roger Hendrix

(In reply to comment #4)
> Now it appears that the JSSE13SocketFactory.java package is attempting to 
> include some files that do not exist.
> 
> Should these files be part of the download done by the ant build.
> 
> Where can I get the missing files to complete the build process?

As I said in my previous reply: Bugzilla is not a support forum. So please post
your question to the Tomcat Users mailing list and provide details about your
build environment. On the list you'll find a lot of people willing and capable
to help you get the problem solved. If it turns out to be indeed a Tomcat bug
(which I doubt), feel free to open a new report in Bugzilla.
I change the bug's status to "ASSIGNED" because for the next Tomcat release the
download location for JDT should be adjusted.
Remy has fixed the JDT issue. The users list is the place for the remaining issues.

description:
I downloaded the tomcat-5.5.20 source build and attempted to build it on my
computer.  The build failed.  Looks like the required file is no longer available:
http://sunsite.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.1.2-200601181600/eclipse-JDT-3.1.2.zip

Complete build output follows:
